p: Compound 6e was prepared from 1 H-indole-3-carbaldehyde 4f (0.064 g, 0.44 mmol), 2–(3,4-diaminophenyl)-3,4,5,6-tetrahydropyrimidin-1-ium chloride 3 (0.100 g, 0.44 mmol), and sodium metabisulfite (0.084 g, 0.44 mmol) in dimethyl sulfoxide (0.8 ml). The resulting free base was converted into salt as described below to obtained 0.033 g (21.3%) of light brown powder; m.p. >300 °C; 1H NMR (600 MHz, DMSO- d 6) δ 11.82 (s, 1H), 10.16 (s, 2H), 8.51 (d, J = 7.2 Hz, 1H), 8.35 (s, 1H), 7.97 (s, 1H), 7.70 (d, J = 8.1 Hz, 1H), 7.52 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 2H), 7.24 (t, J = 6.8 Hz, 1H), 7.21 (t, J = 6.8 Hz, 1H), 3.52 (t, J = 5.5 Hz, 4H), 1.99 (m, 2H); 13 C NMR (151 MHz, DMSO-d 6) δ 159.5, 136.6, 127.4, 125.2, 122.3, 121.4, 121.3, 120.5, 120.5, 112.0, 105.9, 39.0, 18.7; Analysis calcd for C 19H 18ClN 5: C, 64.86; H, 5.16; N, 19.91%; Found: C, 64.83; H, 5.17; N, 19.90%.
